title: 10 Easy Ways To Make Your Home More Energy Efficient
summary: An energy audit is the process of determining which areas of your home are energy inefficient. LED lighting is changing the game when it comes to making your home more energy efficient. Add an eco-friendly roof coating to extend the life of your roof by adding a roof coating. A programmable thermostat allows you to program your heating and cooling system to turn on or off at a certain time. Weather-proof your home is in the fall, when temperatures are still relatively mild and youâ€™re not as rushed to get things done.

var d=Object.defineProperty,u=Object.defineProperties;var c=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var l=(e,t,o)=>t in e?d(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,i=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))s.call(t,o)&&l(e,o,t[o]);if(a)for(var o of a(t))r.call(t,o)&&l(e,o,t[o]);return e},y=(e,t)=>u(e,c(t));var h=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var n in e)s.call(e,n)&&t.indexOf(n)<0&&(o[n]=e[n]);if(e!=null&&a)for(var n of a(e))t.indexOf(n)<0&&r.call(e,n)&&(o[n]=e[n]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var n=o,{components:e}=n,t=h(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,y(i(i({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`As the cost of living continues to rise, it\u2019s more important than ever for Americans to find ways to save money and stay within a budget. After all, no one wants to feel like they\u2019re drowning in bills every month.
To that end, everyone could probably stand to tighten their belts a little bit when it comes to their day-to-day expenses; after all, there are several small things we can do on a daily basis that will collectively add up and help us save money in the long run. In this blog post, we\u2019ll cover everything you need to know about energy efficiency at home and how you can start saving money by making your house more efficient today!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

var u=Object.defineProperty,m=Object.defineProperties;var c=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var i=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(e,o,t)=>o in e?u(e,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[o]=t,r=(e,o)=>{for(var t in o||(o={}))i.call(o,t)&&h(e,t,o[t]);if(a)for(var t of a(o))s.call(o,t)&&h(e,t,o[t]);return e},l=(e,o)=>m(e,c(o));var y=(e,o)=>{var t={};for(var n in e)i.call(e,n)&&o.indexOf(n)<0&&(t[n]=e[n]);if(e!=null&&a)for(var n of a(e))o.indexOf(n)<0&&s.call(e,n)&&(t[n]=e[n]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var n=t,{components:e}=n,o=y(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(r(r({},layoutProps),o),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("h2",null,"How To Make Your Home More Energy Efficient"),mdx("p",null,`The best way to start making your home more energy efficient is by conducting an energy audit. First and foremost, an energy audit is the process of determining which areas of your home are energy inefficient. This information will be used to help you decide which areas of your home require immediate attention when it comes to making it more energy efficient.
A thorough energy audit will also tell you how much money you\u2019re spending each month on energy bills and why you\u2019re spending so much. Armed with this knowledge, you can then decide how you want to go about making your home more energy efficient.`),mdx("h2",null,"Install LED Lighting"),mdx("p",null,`LED lighting is changing the game when it comes to making your home more energy efficient. Simply put, LED lights not only last longer than traditional light bulbs but are also more energy efficient.
A single LED light can last anywhere from 15 to 25 years, and the average LED bulb uses 75% less energy than the average incandescent bulb.
That\u2019s not to say that incandescent bulbs should be completely phased out. There are a few exceptions where they\u2019re better than LED bulbs. The only way to know for sure is to conduct an energy audit of your home.`),mdx("h2",null,"Update Your Appliances"),mdx("p",null,`Appliances that are more than a decade old are costing you money in two ways. First, they\u2019re using more energy than they need to. Second, they\u2019re breaking down more often than they should.
In order to save money on your energy bills while extending the life of your appliances, you should consult a professional to help you select new appliances.
While you may have to spend a little bit of money upfront, the return on investment will be well worth it.`),mdx("h2",null,"Weather-proof Your Home"),mdx("p",null,`If your home has holes that allow outside air to get in, you\u2019re losing money and wasting energy.
Problems like these can be easily identified and solved via an energy audit.
You can also easily fix small holes in your walls (typically caused by pests) by purchasing a can of spray foam.
The best time to weather-proof your home is in the fall, when temperatures are still relatively mild and you\u2019re not as rushed to get things done.`),mdx("h2",null,"Install A Programmable Thermostat"),mdx("p",null,`A programmable thermostat is an easy way to make your home more energy efficient. A programmable thermostat allows you to program your heating and cooling system to turn on or off at a certain time.
When used in conjunction with an energy audit, a programmable thermostat is an excellent way to make your home more energy efficient. If you\u2019re not sure how to install a programmable thermostat, you can hire a professional or refer to the instruction manual.`),mdx("h2",null,"Add Weatherization Basics: Windows And Doors"),mdx("p",null,`Windows and doors are two of the most important areas in your house when it comes to making it more energy efficient. If your windows are old, they\u2019re probably not as energy efficient as they could be.
Ditto for your doors. If you have old doors and windows, you can replace them with new, energy-efficient windows and doors.
If you\u2019re not sure where to start, or if you don\u2019t want to replace them yourself, you can hire a contractor to do the work for you.`),mdx("h2",null,"Add A Smart Thermostat With Climate Control"),mdx("p",null,`An Eco-friendly thermostat like the Ecobee4 or the Nest is an easy way to make your home more energy efficient.
These smart thermostats feature sensors that allow them to keep track of your daily habits and program themselves based on your daily routine.
That way, you don\u2019t have to worry about programming your thermostat manually.
You can also control your thermostat remotely using an app on your phone.`),mdx("h2",null,"Add An Eco-Friendly Roof Coating"),mdx("p",null,`You can extend the life of your roof by adding a roof coating. Specifically, you can add an eco-friendly roof coating that will not only protect your roof but also lower your energy costs.
Why is this important? A roof coating like the Gaco-Shine will not only make your roof last longer but will also lower your energy costs by reflecting the sun\u2019s rays away from your house.
For instance, roof coatings made with silicate minerals can reflect as much as 97% of the sun\u2019s energy away from your roof, thus dramatically lowering your energy costs.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,`Making your home more energy efficient is not only a smart move but also a necessity. These days, it\u2019s not enough to simply get by. We all need to do more with less.
This is especially true when it comes to energy efficiency. No matter what your income level is, you can make your home more energy efficient.
The good news is that it doesn\u2019t cost a lot of money to do so. By following the tips in this article, you can make your home more energy efficient.`),mdx("p",null,"However, you should also remember that there is no one-size-fits-all solution. Every home is different, and there\u2019s no single solution that will work for everyone."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

It\u2019t not the same thing as arbitration or negotiation. Mediation is a voluntary process in which a neutral third party, the mediator, assists others in exploring issues, managing conflict, and solving problems in an effort to resolve conflict and move forward. The parties involved in the dispute remain control over their own destiny at all times. They are free to walk away from mediation at any time with no consequence. The goal of mediation is not compromise but resolution. It\u2019t win-win or lose-lose but instead find a place somewhere between those two extremes where both parties can feel satisfied with the outcome of their dispute.  Mediation services are often provided by private organizations such as nonprofit community mediation centers or faith-based centers that offer these services pro bono publico, which means \u201Cfor the good of the public\u201D without charge."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Your Hobbies

But at the same time, when you don\u2019t have anything that fills your days with joy and meaning, it feels like there are not enough hours in a week. Many people struggle with finding time for their hobbies. They either feel too busy or believe that they simply don\u2019t have the opportunities to pursue something they enjoy. This feeling is understandable\u2014because most people lead incredibly busy lives. Work, school, family, friends, and other obligations take up a lot of time and energy. So how can you carve out some time for your hobbies? It might seem impossible right now\u2014but trust us, it\u2019s possible! Even if your schedule feels full beyond measure right now, there are always little cracks of space that can grow and expand into larger windows of opportunity."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

When the temperature drops and snow begins to pile up, it can be easy for your home to feel like a cold, unforgiving prison. As much as we love cozying up by the fire with hot chocolate and blankets, there has to be something more constructive that you can do in order to break out of this winter funk.
If you want to stay productive this winter and keep from going crazy from cabin fever, now is the perfect time to start focusing on different woodworking projects. Hopefully these will not only keep you busy but also help combat those seasonal blues. Check out these 5 popular new woodworking projects that are sure to keep you busy this winter!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

var y=Object.defineProperty,c=Object.defineProperties;var m=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var i=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,h=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var r=(e,t,o)=>t in e?y(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,s=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))i.call(t,o)&&r(e,o,t[o]);if(n)for(var o of n(t))h.call(t,o)&&r(e,o,t[o]);return e},u=(e,t)=>c(e,m(t));var d=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var a in e)i.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(o[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var a of n(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&h.call(e,a)&&(o[a]=e[a]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var a=o,{components:e}=a,t=d(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,u(s(s({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Your dog might have been house-trained as a puppy, but that doesn\u2019t mean they won\u2019t have accidents as an adult. Maybe you\u2019ve just moved to a new home and your dog hasn\u2019t gotten used to the new smells yet, or maybe he has medical issues that are causing him to have accidents. Whatever the reason, if your dog is having accidents in the house it can be distressing for both of you. However, with time and patience you can help your dog learn again how to toilet outside.
There are various reasons why a dog may stop using the indoor toilet. It may be as simple as them not liking it because of its location or smell or because there\u2019s another person or animal living in the house now who they don\u2019t like seeing when they do their business.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Not Beg at the Table

var u=Object.defineProperty,g=Object.defineProperties;var c=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(t,o,e)=>o in t?u(t,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:e}):t[o]=e,i=(t,o)=>{for(var e in o||(o={}))r.call(o,e)&&h(t,e,o[e]);if(n)for(var e of n(o))s.call(o,e)&&h(t,e,o[e]);return t},l=(t,o)=>g(t,c(o));var d=(t,o)=>{var e={};for(var a in t)r.call(t,a)&&o.indexOf(a)<0&&(e[a]=t[a]);if(t!=null&&n)for(var a of n(t))o.indexOf(a)<0&&s.call(t,a)&&(e[a]=t[a]);return e};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(e){var a=e,{components:t}=a,o=d(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(i(i({},layoutProps),o),{components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`You probably wouldn\u2019t sit down to a meal with your dog at the table every day, but that doesn\u2019t mean you can\u2019t enjoy a nice home-cooked meal with your pup. Dogs are social animals, so they love spending time with their owners and other people. But they also have their weird quirks, like begging at the table or jumping up to get snacks.
Luckily, it\u2019s not hard to train your dog to stop begging at the table and other bad habits. They just take some patience and dedication to follow through on commands until your dog gets it. With these tips, you can crack down on those weird doggy habits and help them learn new things that will last a lifetime. Read on for advice on how to train your dog to stop begging at the table and other tricks as well as tricks from nutritionist Victoria SchENDler`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always Working

var h=Object.defineProperty,p=Object.defineProperties;var g=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var i=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var u=(e,o,t)=>o in e?h(e,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[o]=t,r=(e,o)=>{for(var t in o||(o={}))i.call(o,t)&&u(e,t,o[t]);if(a)for(var t of a(o))s.call(o,t)&&u(e,t,o[t]);return e},l=(e,o)=>p(e,g(o));var m=(e,o)=>{var t={};for(var n in e)i.call(e,n)&&o.indexOf(n)<0&&(t[n]=e[n]);if(e!=null&&a)for(var n of a(e))o.indexOf(n)<0&&s.call(e,n)&&(t[n]=e[n]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var n=t,{components:e}=n,o=m(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(r(r({},layoutProps),o),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Working too much is a problem many people struggle with \u2014 but it\u2019s even more challenging when you\u2019re in a relationship with someone who has the same work ethic. If your partner usually leaves for work before you even get out of bed, or isn\u2019t home until after you\u2019re already in bed, things can get tricky.
Working from home, flexible hours and remote working are all buzzwords in today\u2019s labor market. Companies are becoming increasingly aware that it isn\u2019t just about how much time employees spend at the desk but also about what they achieve during that time. A Gallup poll found that telecommuting or working from home is growing in popularity among professionals across most industries. Working remotely makes it easier to find jobs, negotiate schedules and live without a commute.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

If you\u2019re eligible to mediate, that might depend on the type of case you have and who you are. For example, there may be other requirements that you meet to qualify as an eligible candidate.
